title: Computex 2017 Taipei: All the latest news | Trusted Reviews
description:
![Computex
2016](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**Computex 2017 (Taipei) News and Latest Rumours: Computing Editor Michael
Passingham is providing updates from Computex 2017, along with information on
what to expect from this year’s hardware heaven.**

Taking place between **May 30 and June 3** , the world’s biggest computing
show is spread all over Taipei, the capital of Taiwan, with thousands of
exhibitors showing off everything from keyboard switches to… more keyboard
switches.

Oh, and loads more computing hardware. Here’s the skinny on this year’s event
so far:

## Computex 2017: What’s happened so far?

**Gigabyte’s little and large gaming machines**

Gigabyte launched a few new products at Computex, but by far the most
interesting was the [Aorus X9](https://www.trustedreviews.com/aorus-x9-review
"Aorus X9"), which is a behemoth dual-GTX 1070 laptop with a stunning design.
The company also announced its new [Brix
Gaming](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/gigabyte-brix-gaming-launch-specs
"gigabye Brix gaming") PCs, which are small enough to chuck into your bag but
powerful enough to play VR games.

![Gigabyte Brix
gaming](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**Corsair wows with Concept desktops**

## Latest

  * [ ![Twitter Trump](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-reviews-placeholder-3.svg) Credit: @lgbtfeedla 

###  Twitter gives users more power to report fakers, as purge continues

](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/twitter-is-giving-users-more-power-to-
report-fake-accounts-as-purge-continues-3613624 "Twitter gives users more
power to report fakers, as purge continues")

  * [ ![Amazon Echo Dot \(3rd Gen\) 1 hero](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

### Alexa’s new whisper mode rolls out in US today – here’s how to enable it

](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/how-to-enable-alexa-whisper-mode-
echo-3607478 "Alexa’s new whisper mode rolls out in US today – here’s how to
enable it")

  *   * [ ![LG CLOi hero](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

### LG CLOi robots in action – from cute personal assistants to industrial
floor care

](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/lg-cloi-robot-3600210 "LG CLOi robots in
action – from cute personal assistants to industrial floor care")

  * 

Corsair’s no stranger to producing classy, high-end PC cases, but the [Concept
Slate and Concept Curve](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/corsair-concept-
slate-wireless-charging-mouse "Corsair Concepts") desktops the company showed
off at its booth were seriously impressive even by its standards. There was
also a weird wireless-charging mousemat. What’s not to like? **  
**

**![Corsair Concept
Slate](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)**

**MSI bucks the gaming laptop trend  
**

MSI went in its own direction at Computex, launching the huge [GT75VR
Titan](https://www.trustedreviews.com/msi-gt75vr-titan-review "GT75 Titan")
laptop. Specced up with an overclockable CPU and GPU, it’s a mighty impressive
machine that weighs a metaphorical tonne. **  
**

**![MSI GT75VR
Titan](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)**

**Qualcomm chips come to Windows**

ARM-powered Windows laptops are nearly here, with [Qualcomm and Microsoft
announcing](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/windows-10-qualcomm-
snapdragon-835-arm-chips "Snapdragon 835 windows 10") the chipmaker’s flagship
Snapdragon 835 platform will be integerated into upcoming Windows 10 laptops.
**  
**

**AMD asks us to wait  
**

2017’s been a good year so far for AMD, but unlike its 2016 Computex
conference, we didn’t get much in the way of new products or exciting news.
Slow and steady is good, sure, but it would have been nice to see a new
graphics card launch. Instead, the firm will launch its new [RX
Vega](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/amd-vega-specs-performance-release-
date-technology-explained "AMD Vega") gaming card at the end of July.

There was more news, too. It was confirmed that the company’s unlaunched quad-
core Ryzen 3 CPUs would be certified Oculus Rift-compatible, as if there was
any doubt. The company also showed off its gigantic ThreadRipper desktop CPU
in the flesh. It’s definitely quite big. **  
**

**![ThreadRipper
motherboards](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)  
**

Finally, the company showed off a 2-in-1 laptop powered by [Ryzen
Mobile](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/amd-ryzen-mobile-laptops-vega-
performance-price-release-date "Ryzen Mobile"), the as-yet unspecified laptop-
specific APU that’ll ship later this year. It looked very thin and light and
AMD showed proof it was legit by playing a video on it, but without specifics,
all we can really see is a pre-production laptop. Still, it gives me hope that
Ryzen Mobile laptops will be as thin and light as Intel-powered machines, and
maybe even more powerful. The firm also showed off five Ryzen desktop PCs from
Acer, Lenovo, Asus, Dell and HP to reaffirm how strong its partnerships with
each company really is.

![Ryzen Mobile
laptop](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**Zotac goes big  
**

Mini PC maker [Zotac launched a new range of slightly larger
PCs](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/zotac-mini-pcs-ryzen-gtx-1050 "zotac
Mek"), called MEK. They’re tall, thin and they look a little bit like cyclops
robots.

**![Zotac
MEK](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)**

**Dell launches new desktops**

Not to be outdone, [Dell’s launched a few notable new
products](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/dell-unveils-three-new-amd-
powered-inspiron-desktops "Dell inspiron computex"). There’s a pair of all-in-
one PCs, both of which come with AMD 7th-gen processors, as well as the
Inspiron Gaming Desktop, which comes with the latest AMD Ryzen chips and a
choice of Nvidia or AMD GPUs.

![Dell Inspiron
gaming](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**Acer launches massive curved monitor  
**

As expected, Acer had a quiet Computex. The company is here, and I’ve seen
their booth. But the only new product is a new 35-inch curved gaming monitor.
No doubt the Predator Z35P is a lovely piece of kit, with a 3440 x 1440-pixel
panel, Nvidia G-Sync, a pair of 9W speakers and decent colours. It can even
refresh at 100Hz for super-smooth gaming. **  
**

**![Acer
Z35P](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)**

**Core blimey! Intel Core i9 revealed**

Intel’s only gone and launched a desktop processor with 18 cores, along with a
load more chips ranging from Core i5 all the way up to the brand-new [Core i9
model](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/intel-core-i9-specs-release-date-
skylake-x "Intel Core i9").

**Asus second press conference: Buckets of gaming gear**

Asus just held its second press conference of the week, this time for its
Republic of Gamers brand. I’m still working my way through the announcements,
but the biggest was the reveal of the [ROG
Zephyrus](https://www.trustedreviews.com/asus-rog-zephyrus-review "Asus ROG
Zephyrus"), one of the most incredible gaming laptops I’ve seen.

![Asus ROG
Zephyr](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

The company also launched the [world’s first Ryzen
laptop](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/asus-rog-strix-first-ryzen-laptop
"Asus ROG Strix").

**Nvidia unveils new Max-Q gaming laptop standard**

Nvidia used its Computex press conference to launch the new
[Max-Q](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/nvidia-max-q-laptops-thin-and-
light-gaming "Nvidia Max-Q") gaming laptop standard – set to be used by most
of the world’s gaming laptop manufacturers.

The standard lays out specifications for design and internal hardware, and has
been conceived to balance performance and battery life. Essentially, Max-Q
laptops must have a thickness of less than 18mm and a weight of under 5lbs, or
about 2.1kg.

On top of that, manufacturers have to keep fan noise below 40dBA, which can be
done using advanced cooling and newly developed, highly-efficient electrical
designs.

![Nvidia
Max-Q](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

But perhaps the most interesting Max-Q requirement is a [GTX
1080](https://www.trustedreviews.com/nvidia-geforce-gtx-1080-review "GTX 1080
review") GPU. Considering the specification requires a thin and light design,
that means we’ll be seeing some incredibly capable gaming laptops that remain
portable. Max-Q laptops can also come equipped with GTX 1070s and 1060s.

Computex should yield several Max-Q laptops as all the big gaming laptop
companies try to get in on the action so stay tuned. Nvidia expects widespread
availability from June 17.

**First Asus press conference, three new laptops announced  
**

While I was in the air, making my way to Taipei, Asus jump-started the show by
launching a bunch of new ZenBook and VivoBook devices.

Asus Chairman Jonney Shi lead proceedings.

There were four key announcements that are entirely new products. The Intel
Core i7-7700HQ-powered [ZenBook
Pro](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/nvidia-max-q-laptops-thin-and-light-
gaming "ZenBook Pro") leads the pack, with specifications that are set to
rival the likes of the [Dell XPS 15](https://www.trustedreviews.com/dell-
xps-15-review "Dell Inspiron 15 Gaming review"). There’s an Nvidia GeForce GTX
1050 Ti on-board, along with up to a 1TB PCIe SSD and 16GB DDR4 RAM.

Shih also debuted the world’s thinnest convertible [ZenBook Flip
S](https://www.trustedreviews.com/asus-zenbook-flip-s-review "ZenBook Flip
S"), which comes with a 4K display. At 10.9mm thick and weighing 1.1kg, and
packing a 7th Generation Intel Core i7-7500U processor and a super-quick 1TB
PCIe SSD, the Flip S is entering into a competitive market, where the likes of
the HP Spectre x360 and Dell XPS 13 2-in-1 have a bit of a headstart.

![Asus Computex
2017](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

Asus also took the opportunity to launch a new VivoBook Pro 15, which comes
with Intel’s seventh-generation processors and Nvidia’s GeForce GTX 1050.
Meanwhile, the VivoBook S15 isn’t quite as powerful, but there’s still an
Nvidia GeForce GTX 940 chip on-board. The company also reintroduced the
[ZenBook 3 Deluxe](https://www.trustedreviews.com/asus-zenbook-3-deluxe-review
"Asus ZenBook 3 Deluxe") that I saw at CES

**Watch: Laptop buying guide**

What are you hoping to see at Computex 2017? Let us know in the comments
below.
